Click the plus button to add an additional relative efficiency detector response function file.
Click the plus button to add an additional directory to recursively look for detector response functions in.
You can place detector response functions imported from GADRAS-DRF into InterSpecs directory within the Files app.
These are detector response functions imported from GADRAS-DRF. Currently only the detector dimensions, absolute efficiencies, and FWHM resolutions are used.

Remove directory from list of directories InterSpec will look in for detector response functions in.
Set entered directory to recursively look in for detector response functions.
No valid DRFs in directory, or its subdirectories.

message.div: The first column is energy in keV. Second column is the % efficient (0 through 100) for gammas at that energy, incident on the detector, to be recorded in the photopeak.
You will also need to upload a GADRAS Detector.dat file, or enter the detectors diameter, after uploading the efficiency file.
You can also upload CSV exported from the Make Detector Response tool.

messages.message: Enter detector diameter or upload Detector.dat file:
Detector efficiency defined by a mathematical formula, given the energy x; or you can enter the coefficients for the standard equation form. Click the question mark icon for more info.

How this efficiency should be interpreted.
Intrinsic Efficiency: the probability for a x-ray or gamma striking the face of the detector, to register a full-energy detection event.
Absolute Efficiency: the probability for a x-ray or gamma from the source to register a full-energy detection event, with it being appropriate to allow scaling this efficiency by 1/r2 to other distances (i.g., is for a point-source).
Fixed Geometry - total activity: the probability for a x-ray or gamma from the source to register a full-energy detection event, and it is not appropriate to allow scaling this efficiency to other distances (e.g., for a near, or large extended source).
Fixed Geometry - activity per cm2: similar to total activity, but the efficiency curve represents efficiency per decay, per square centimeter (i.e., surface contamination).
Fixed Geometry - activity per m2: similar to per cm2, but for per square meter.
Fixed Geometry - activity per g: similar to per cm2, but for per gram of source.
Use as default DRF for SN '{1}'
Use as default DRF for model '{1}'
Remove all changes or selections made by this dialog, and close the dialog.
Accept all changes/selections made and close dialog.
Detector response function URL was invalid.
